content: This is a very inspirational article and I quite like the idea that our thoughts are only suggestions that can be monitored and either accepted or disregarded. I practice milder forms of mental resistance training such as pushing myself during workouts and not calling it a day until I have delivered on strictly set daily goals at work. Question though: Where do you draw the line? When does persevering through tiredness and discomfort actually start negatively impacting your performance and productivity?
